segments.lesson_summary: Summary of segment 1: In math Class 3, we learn about conversions and examples like the week and time. One example could be figuring out when a party is happening on Tuesday when it was originally scheduled for Monday. How many days until the party now and how many answers could there be? When you increase a number by a factor of 10, you add a zero to the right of the number. This is like multiplying the number by 10. It's easier to understand this concept using calculations and examples.
